DOC.brief_summary: How effective is sugar in reducing the debriding of sloughy, necrotic or infected exudating wounds compared with standard treatment?
DOC.brief_title: Use of White Granulated Sugar on Wounds
DOC.detailed_description: Patients for whom all the following apply: Have an exudating wound sizes 5cm2 and 40cm2 A minimum of 25% slough, infected and necrotic tissue No dry necrotic eschar present Ankle Brachial Pressure Index of greater than 0.6 Are over 18 years Independently and willingly consent
DOC.criteria: Exudating wound sizes 5cm2 and 40cm2 A minimum of 25% slough, infected and necrotic tissue No dry necrotic eschar Ankle Brachial Pressure Index of greater than 0.6 Age over 18 years Able to independently and willingly consent Participants in a trial evaluating other therapies for their wound Have previously been in this trial Women who are pregnant Participants not able to tolerate daily dressing change
